title: n.w.a
body:
[b]N.W.A[/b] (an abbreviation for [u]Niggaz Wit Attitudes[/u]) was an American hip-hop group from "Compton":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Compton%2C_California, [[California]]. The group emerged in the late 1980s and is often credited with popularizing gangsta rap, a subgenre of hip-hop characterized by its gritty and often explicit lyrics that depicted the realities of urban life, especially within African-American communities.

The most notable members of N.W.A included [i]"Eazy-E":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eazy-E[/i], [i]"Dr. Dre":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dr._Dre[/i], [i]"Ice Cube":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_Cube[/i], [i]"MC Ren":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MC_Ren[/i], and [i]"DJ Yella":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DJ_Yella[/i]. The group's music was known for its explicit content, raw social commentary, and unapologetic portrayal of life in Compton.

Their debut album, '[[Straight Outta Compton]],' released in 1988, is one of the most significant albums in hip-hop history. The album featured tracks like  [i]"'Fuck tha Police'":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fuck_tha_Police[/i] that addressed issues of [[police]] brutality and racial profiling. The album's controversial content led to it being banned by many radio stations and retailers, but it also gained a strong underground following, spreading through word-of-mouth.

While N.W.A disbanded in the early 1990s due to internal conflicts and creative differences, their legacy remains influential in hip-hop and popular culture. The group's members also went on to have successful solo careers in music, film, and other entertainment industries. 

The group's story was depicted in the 2015 biographical film [i]"'Straight Outta Compton'":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Straight_Outta_Compton_(film)[/i]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: N.W.A":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/N.W.A

title: prinz_rupprecht_(azur_lane)
body:
[i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s personification of a German battlecruiser design as part of a collaboration with [i][[World of Warships]][/i]. 
Voiced by [[Asakura Momo]].

Prinz Rupprecht is an origin of a WW1 Battlecruiser for the Imperial German Navy (or known as Kaiserliche Marine). "Based on the Schnelle Großekampfschiffe GK 4541":[https://thedailybounce.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/08/Schnelle_GrosseKampfschiffe_4541_100dpi-2048x1278.jpg?ezimgfmt=ng:webp/ngcb1] .

Throughout her design, she gets a hypothetical refit with Kriegsmarine Equipment, but the drawbacks for this she has only have Short-Range and Long-Range Anti Air Defenses. Other appearances she has [[Long Horns]], [[pink hair]], [[huge horns]], [[asymmetrical legwear]], [[purple eyes]] and [[Iron Cross]], which is common for German ships. 


h4. Appearance

* !post #5507783: Default
* !post #6008193: [[Prinz Rupprecht (The Gate Dragon Advent) (Azur Lane)|The Gate Dragon Advent]]
* !post #8168033: [[Prinz Rupprecht (Midnight Pearl) (Azur Lane)|Midnight Pearl]]

h4. External links

* "World of warships Ship Visual":[https://i.ytimg.com/vi/J_Hm4jH1PRs/maxresdefault.jpg]

title: meister_(ragnarok_online)
body:
4th job of the Blacksmith class tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Usually are equipped with a [[holding wrench|wrench]] or a [[holding hammer|hammer]].

Males wear an [[open jacket|open]] [[brown jacket]] with a [[gold trim]], a [[blue shirt]], [[brown gloves|brown]] [[fingerless gloves]], a [[brown belt]], [[brown pants]] with [[white socks]] [[socks over pants|over them]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[armored boots]].

Females wear a [[open jacket|open]] [[grey jacket]] with a [[gold trim]], a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[brown shirt|brown]] [[two-tone shirt|and]] [[white shirt]] with both [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] and [[navel cutout]]s, [[brown gloves|brown]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[brown shorts|brown]] [[short shorts]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[armored boots]].

Males wear a [[patterned clothing|patterned]] [[black capelet]], a [[black coat]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[two-tone shirt|and]] [[white shirt]] with [[short over long sleeves]], [[black pants]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]]. 

Females wear a [[sleeveless coat|sleeveless]] [[purple coat]], a [[red vest]] over a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[black sash|black]] [[obi]], [[white socks]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]].

title: cheese_(sonic)
body:
Cheese is a fictional character that appears in the [[Sonic_(series)|Sonic the Hedgehog]] series. Cheese is distinguished from other [[Chao_(sonic)|Chao]] by their [[red bowtie]]. Cheese, being a Chao, does not have a gender, but is sometimes referred to as male.

Cheese is also [[Cream the Rabbit]]'s pet Chao, hence the play on words; "cream and cheese".

title: mother_2
body:
The second game of the [[MOTHER (series)|]] (EarthBound) franchise from [[Nintendo]]. Officially titled [i]MOTHER 2: Gyiyg Strikes Back[/i], it was released for the [[Super Famicom]] on August 27, 1994.

This game was translated and released for the [[Super Nintendo]] in North America on June 5, 1995, officially titled [i]EarthBound: The War Against Giygas[/i]. On June 20, 2003, this game was re-released in Japan for the [[Game Boy Advance]] along with [[MOTHER 1]] in a 2-in-1 game: [i]MOTHER 1+2[/i].

title: capri-sun
body:
A brand of juice concentrate–based drinks manufactured by the German company Wild and regional licensees, such as [[Kraft|Kraft Foods]] in the United States. From the start they have packaged their drinks in laminated foil vacuum [[drink pouch|pouches]], with which the brand has become strongly associated with. Originally sold in West Germany and wider Europe as [i]Capri-Sonne[/i], the name was discontinued in recent years in favor of their English name [i]Capri-Sun[/i]. Kraft sells the drink as branded as [i]Capri Sun[/i], without the dash.

title: horizon
body:
The horizon is the border between [[earth (planet)|]] and [[sky]]. As the horizon is usually obscured by trees, mountains, buildings, etc., it is most visible in settings dominated by the [[ocean]] or other featureless terrain.

When the outline of a city is visible over the horizon, this is known as a [[skyline]].

If the horizon is tilted with respect to the picture frame, the result is a [[dutch angle]].

title: drink_pouch
body:
A plastic and/or metal foil pouch used for beverages.  These pouches are fully-sealed, unlike a [[drink bag]], and feature either a spout or require a straw to puncture the pouch to drink the contents.

In the United States the drink brand [[Capri-Sun]] is noted for their aluminum-foil drink pouches.  In Asia there are a lot more types of drinks available in this packaging, such as jelly drinks.

title: milk_bag
body:
A plastic bag that contains milk.  It is used as a packaging equivalent to [[milk carton]]s or plastic milk jug.  In places in Canada where milk is commonly sold bagged, the bags are used by putting them into a small [[pitcher (container)|]] sized for the bag and then the corner of the bag cut to allow for pouring.

Small milk bags were introduced into US schools in the late 80's and early 90's, but fell out of favor.  A common issue for kids was inserting the straw into the bag without spilling the milk.

h4. See also

* [[Drink bag]]
* [[Drink pouch]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Milk bag":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milk_bag]

title: drink_bag
body:
A small hand sized, [[plastic bag]] used to contain drink, such as [[tea]], [[juice]] or other beverages. The [[drink]] inside is usually consumed with a [[drinking straw]]. It is commonly seen in Southeast Asian countries, such as [[Indonesia]], [[Malaysia]] and the [[Philippines]] as a cheaper substitute to [[disposable cup]].

h4. See also

* [[Drink pouch]]
* [[Milk bag]]

title: ambush
body:
An [b]ambush[/b] is a [[battle]] tactic where a character takes advantage of concealment or the [[surprised|element of surprise]] to [[attack]] unsuspecting characters from [[hiding|concealed]] positions, such as among dense underbrush or behind [[hill]]tops. Sometimes, an ambush can involve the exclusive or combined use of [[explosive|improvised explosive devices]], that allow the attacking characters to hit the targeted characters while minimizing the risk of being exposed to return fire.

In most [[tag group:role-playing games|RPG games]], an ambush will forbid all player actions, allowing the enemy to act first (example of indications: [[red theme|red swirl]] in [[mother (series)|MOTHER/EarthBound]], swapped positions in [[Final Fantasy]]).

h4. See also

* [[surprised]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ambush":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambush]

title: annet_myer
body:
Fictional female character and main protagonist of the 2D side-scrolling [[fantasy]] action [[video game]] [[El Viento]] released in 1991 for the [[Sega Mega Drive]].

[b]Annet Myer[/b] is a [[Peru]] [[Incan]] sorceress skilled with the use of bladed boomerangs and magical spells. Her name in Spanish (the actual language used in [[Peru]]) is more correctly spelled [b]Anita Mier[/b].

title: fad_assault_rifle
body:
The [b]FAD[/b], also known as [b]Dual Automatic Rifle[/b] (Spanish: [i][b]F[/b]usil [b]A[/b]utomático [b]D[/b]oble[/i]) is an advanced [[Peru]] automatic weapon designed in 2008 by Salomón Braga Lozo of [i]SIMA Electronica[/i], a division of the state owned SIMA (Spanish: [i]Servicio Industrial de la Marina[/i]) shipyards, based in the port of "Callao":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Callao , [[Peru]].

The FAD is a futuristic looking [[assault rifle]] centered around the NATO 5.56x45mm cartridge that offers low recoil, low weight and volume while at the same time giving precision, adequate range and ergonomy coupled with a "pump-action" type 40 mm grenade launcher in a single package. It is also a light "Bullpup" rifle that can easily be used as a back-up weapon by armored crews.

title: falke_(signalis)
body:
Replika Type FLKR (Führrungs Kommando Leiteinheit Replika | Operational Command Control Unit Replica) | Falke

The [[Falke_(Signalis) | Falke]] (Falcon in German.) is a character / unit in the game [[Signalis]]. 

Falke's are commander units meant to lead the security forces in the facilities in the Signalis universe, whether it be prison, mining, research or any other type of facility used by the Eusan Nation. They are typically perceived as godlike beings towards other Replika units, solidifying their status as commanders or leaders within their facilities.

In the game, the player encounters a comatose Falke during their playthrough.

Gameplay Spoilers :

[spoilers] Later in the game, the facility's Falke will awaken and you will need to fight them to continue the story. [/spoilers]

h6. Appearance
On top of being an [[android]], the Falke unit has in terms of notable visual traits, the following : [[Very long hair | Very long]], [[black_hair | black hair]], [[Blue_Eyes|blue eyes]], a half golden [[Laurel_Crown|laurel crown]] as a [[Hair_Ornament|hair ornament]] and [[forehead_mark | three marks]] on their forehead. 
Clothing wise, the Falke unit wears a black {{bodysuit}} with golden ornaments. Most notably golden rings on the leg and arm parts and the symbols on the right side of their torso.

title: tre_kronor
body:
"Tre kronor" translates to "Three Crowns" and is Sweden's heraldic national symbol with a long history. It is used in the [[coat of arms]]/[[logo]] of many governmental branches.

It consists of three three-peaked crowns in an equilateral triangle, with two on top and one in the bottom. The most common shape of the insignia is that of a shield, but the air force uses a round version on their vehicles, in which case there is a border in the same colour as the crowns. In its base form, the crowns are yellow on a blue fill. On military vehicles colourless versions are often used, with black (or dark grey) crowns and border with no fill, which is used on bright surfaces, or a white fill with black or transparent crowns and no border, used on darker surfaces. Very old army vehicles can be seen in pictures and museums painted with a rectangular version of the insignia in the latter colour scheme. However, the rectangular insignia was eventually dropped in favour of painting the [[Swedish flag]] instead.

h4. See also

* [[Swedish air force]]
* [[Sweden]]
* [[Swedish uniform]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three_Crowns

title: k9_(dog)
body:
A K9 or K-9 are specifically trained [[dog]]s to assist [[police|law enforcement]] and [[military]] personnel.  They're trained to assist in various duties, such as searching for drugs and explosives, locating missing or wounded people, finding crime scene evidence, protecting officers and other people, detecting enemy or intruders, and chasing and subduing fleeing suspects.

The breeds most commonly used by law enforcement and the military are the [[German Shepherd]], Belgian Malinois, Bloodhound, Dutch Shepherd, and [[Labrador Retriever]].  [[Rottweiler]] and Doberman Pinscher were also common breeds early on, but have since fallen out of favor.

h4. Examples

* !post #7263940: German Shepherd

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Police dog":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Police_dog]

title: qingque_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]].

An average Diviner of the Divination Commission on the Xianzhou Luofu, and a librarian. She never slacks off when it comes to slacking off and is about to be demoted to a "door guardian." 

Fights using [[Mahjong tile]]s.

h4. Appearance
* !post #7690418: Splash art

h4. Profile
[expand]
An average Diviner of the Divination Commission, who will never slack off when it comes to slacking off.

She passed the Divination Commissions entrance exam to please her parents, only to discover what she had originally thought to be a relaxing public servant job to instead be very intensive and a worker's nightmare.

After several years of experience, Qingque had finally honed her craft — No matter which department she changes to, she remains the lowest level of Diviners.

"When there's nothing else left to do, why not bury your head in a book or play cards? What more could I ask for"
[/expand]

h4. See Also
* [[Qingque (Lucky Snack) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Ruan Mei's creations: Lucky Snack]]

title: konohanasakuya-hime_(mythology)
body:
(Konohana Sakuya-Hime, lit. Princess Blossoming Flower of the Tree)

A goddess in [[Japanese mythology]]. Her name was described as 木花之佐久夜毘売 (Konohana no Sakuya-Bime) in the "Kojiki.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kojiki 

She and her sister, Iwanaga-hime (Stone Longevity Princess) are the daughters of the mountain god Ohoyamatsumi. The mythology about them and "Ninigi-no-Mikoto":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ninigi-no-Mikoto is considered as a variation of "”the Stone and the Banana.”":http://www.mircea-eliade.com/from-primitives-to-zen/069.html Later she became associated with [[Mount Fuji]].

[[Konohana Sakuya (persona)|]], [[Amagi Yukiko]]'s persona in [[Persona 4]] was named after this goddess.

h4.See also

* Wikipedia: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Konohanasakuya-hime

title: yunjian
body: A yunjian is an ornate [[Chinese clothes|traditional Chinese]] collar. It translates to cloud collar; its namesake derives from its dulating trim, of which is often cloud-like in design. It is sometimes also made to resemble feathers. The yunjian also often features [[print collar|elaborate print]] designs, and sometimes features several [[tassel]]s. The collar was popular during the [[ming_dynasty|Ming]] and [[qing_dynasty|Qing]] dynasties, and was mostly used during [[Chinese wedding|weddings]] and banquets. h4. Examples * !post #5396498 * !post #7401733 h4. External links "Wikipedia: Yunjian":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yunjian]

title: watanabe:_astral_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Watanabe (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
An alternative frame for Watanabe, designed for piloting high altitude aircrafts, similar designs to a [[pilot suit]]. His Astral frame is mostly black and grey in coloration, has features such as a [[chest harness]], [[pouch]]/[[belt pouch]]es and [[mechabare]]. His [[medium hair|medium length]] [[grey hair]] is more naturally presented, his [[hair between eyes|bangs falls between his eyes]], covering his forehead barcode, and he has a short [[low ponytail]].

He has [[heterochromia]] eyes, [[blue eyes|blue left]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow right]], a [[bandaid on cheek|bandaid on right cheek]].

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])
* [[watanabe: astral (field training) (pgr)|Field Training]]

title: power_(pgr)
body:
[[nanami (pgr)|Nanami]]'s [[externally_piloted_mecha|externally piloted mecha]] used by her [[nanami: starfarer (pgr)|Starfarer]] frame.

Featuring shoulder rocket launch [[missile pod|pods]], [[pile bunker]] on the right arm and a foldable [[chainsword]] on the left.  In the [[nanami: starfarer (night navigator) (pgr)|Night Navigator]] skin, Power takes on a 21st century space vehicle theme akin to the ISS/NASA, but the mechanical parts function and bodily aspects remains the same.

body:
A character who debuts in [[Senran Kagura New Link]] as the main antagonist, and later becoming an ally character as part of the recently formed Amagi Sealing Congregation.

Toki is a girl with [[very long hair|extremely long]] [[brown hair]] with two [[red hair|red]] [[streaked hair|streaks]] tied in a [[hair ring]] and a [[huge breasts|massive bust]] almost close to [[murasaki (senran kagura)|Murasaki's]]. She wears an elaborate, [[revealing clothes|revealing]] [[white kimono]] with a [[stomach cutout]] revealing her [[navel]] a with red highlights, black stockings, with [[mismatched earrings]] blue on the right and green on a the left, with [[fur trim]] on her waist, with [[detached collar]] with [[detached sleeves|detached]] [[wide sleeves]], with a [[neck tassel]] between her [[cleavage]], with [[black footwear|black]] [[sandals]] and a [[chinese knot]] resemble a flower. Her eyes are blue, with Kagan's signature pink petals replacing her irises.

Her seiyuu is [[Takahashi Rie]]

title: ultraman_cosmos_(eclipse_mode)
body:
[[Ultraman Cosmos]]'s super form, obtained in episode 30 of [[Ultraman Cosmos (series)|]].

This form was achieved after his defeat at the hands of Chaos Header and his revival under a lunar eclipse. This form represents the 'courage' of Musashi which revived Cosmos and combined the powers of Luna and Corona, making it more powerful than either form. It is the only form to require the presence of Musashi. Cosmos can only fight for roughly one minute in this form as it drains a lot of energy.

title: berserk
body:
An ongoing seinen dark fantasy action/horror manga series by [[Miura Kentarou]] that has been adapted into a 25-episode anime, a film trilogy, and summer 2016 TV anime series.

It follows the story of [[Guts (berserk)|]], the Black Swordsman, who wanders the earth fighting off demons that are drawn to the [[Brand of Sacrifice]] mark on his neck. Guts seeks revenge against [[Griffith (berserk)|]], his former best friend, whose betrayal led to the loss of Guts' hand and eye, and nearly everyone he cared about.

Miura passed away on May 6, 2021, leaving the series unfinished.  On June 7, 2022 it was announced that Miura's Studio Gaga under the supervision of Kouji Mori, a close friend of Miura, would resume the series utilizing material left behind or talked about by Miura before his passing.

title: fig_sign
body:
The Fig Sign is a hand gesture made with the hand and fingers curled into a fist and the thumb thrust between the middle and index fingers (or more rarely the middle and ring finger).  While not readily known in the US and many other English speaking countries, the same hand sign is used while playing the children's game I've Got Your Nose. 

The origin of the gesture is unknown and its meaning varies depending on where you are in the world.  In some places the gesture is used for good luck, particularly when used on small decorative hands carved into this gesture that are used as charms, in others, it's used as a mild version of the [[middle finger]] (such as in Russia, where it is called colloquially "кукиш/kukish" or "дуля/dulya", and is seen as a rude way to reject, deny, or dismiss someone).  The meaning of the gesture in the images on Danbooru will commonly mean something akin to "let's fuck."

h4. Examples

* !post #1609687

h4. See also

* [[penetration gesture]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

title: bossk
body:
Bossk'wassak'Cradossk, known more commonly as Bossk is a [[Star Wars]] character, he was a male Trandoshan bounty hunter and the son of Cradossk who was known for hunting Wookiees. During the Clone Wars, Bossk worked alongside fellow hunters Aurra Sing and Castas to mentor the orphaned [[Boba Fett]]. Their scheme to kill Fett's hated enemy, the Jedi Master [[Mace Windu]], resulted in Fett and Bossk's arrest. 
After the rise of the Empire, Bossk continued to be one of the biggest names in the bounty hunting business despite eventually drifting apart from Fett and working mostly solo. Bossk also took part in hunting Wookiees that were natural enemies of his species, particularly growing a distaste for the [[Wookiee]] [[Chewbacca]] and his partner, the human [[Han Solo]]. Despite just having finished a mission where his last surviving sibling, his sister Doshanalawook, made him swear to stop hunting Wookiees, Bossk was called upon by [[Darth Vader]] to find and capture Solo, Chewbacca, and their ship, the [[Millennium Falcon]].

title: guimpe
body:
Pronounced 'gyump' - an article of clothing, typically comprised of a [[white collar]] that coveres the neck and shoulders of the wearer, and sometimes the entire chest as well. 

Historically worn by women to represent social standing and modesty. Most often depicted on [[nun]]s.

h4. See also
* [[Puritan collar]]
* [[Wimple]]

title: wimple
body:
A type of headwear that typically covers the head in a similar fashion to a [[detached hood]] - that is, wound snugly around the head, leaving the face bare, but covering the jaw and ears. When worn in this fashion, it is also referred to as a barbette. 

Derived from [[medieval]] times, the wimple is most often seen in depictions of [[traditional nun]]s, where it is worn under a [[veil]], and often attached to a [[guimpe]] - this is a collar, usually white, that covers the shoulders.

h4. Examples
* !post #7578778
* !post #350904
* !post #726

title: sen_to_chihiro_no_kamikakushi
body:
A 2001 Japanese animated [[fantasy]] film written and directed by [[miyazaki_hayao_(person)|Miyazaki Hayao]] and produced by [[Studio Ghibli]]. 

Known in America simply as [b]Spirited Away[/b], this movie is about a a shy and timid girl, [[ogino chihiro|Chihiro]], whose family is moving. In the process they visit an abandoned theme park, which turns out to be the entrance to the spirit world. Trapped there, she gets a job at the local bath house, where she learns about the magnificent world of spirits. She is guided by a mysterious boy named [[Haku (sen to chihiro no kamikakushi)|]] as she tries to make her way home.

It garnered the [[the academy awards|Oscar]] for Best Animated Feature in 2003, the first anime movie to win an Oscar.

title: cel_rendering
body: A technique found in [[3D]] media that mimics the appearance of 2D illustrations. A well-known example is [[The Legend of Zelda]]'s [[the_legend_of_zelda:_breath_of_the_wild|Breath of the Wild]]. In 3D media, cel rendering is typically employed by use of minimalist textures and shaders. This may include hard-edged shadows and highlights, sometimes to a degree that causes visual [[color banding]], and other times, there may be [[flat color|an intentional omission of shadows]] altogether (e.g. [[Untitled Goose Game]]). There may also be use of a prominent outline ([[ookami_(game)|Okami]]), and on the flipside, there may be an [[no lineart|omission of an outline]] altogether. For the 2D cel shading technique, see [[anime coloring]] instead. h4. Media examples Anime * [[ajin_(sakurai_gamon)|Ajin]] * [[BanG Dream!]] * [[Trigun Stampede]] Videogames * [[Jet Set Radio]] * [[shin_subarashiki_kono_sekai|NEO: The World Ends With You]] * [[Ni no Kuni]] * [[The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker]] h4. See also * [[Low poly]]

title: osana_najimi_(komi-san_wa_komyushou_desu)
body:
A character in [[Komi-san wa Komyushou desu]]. [b]Osana Najimi[/b], a person of [[androgynous|indeterminable gender]] at [[Komi Shouko]]'s high school. Is childhood friends with EVERY student at said school except for Komi herself. Has alternated expressed gender every school year.

They have [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] stylized with bangs & [[antenna hair]]. Their [[school uniform]] consists of a [[open jacket|open]] [[blue jacket|blue]] [[blazer]], [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[striped necktie]], [[diagonal-striped skirt|diagonal-striped]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[loafers]].

h4. External links

* "Komi-san Wiki: Osana Najimi":https://komisan.fandom.com/wiki/Najimi_Osana

title: monica_blanchflower
body:
モニカ・ブランチフラワー (Monica Blanchflower)

A leading character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story. 

She was born in Britain and raised in Japan. Although she is a 17 year old third-year high school student, she has smoking habit. She likes [[brand_name_imitation|Madnald]]'s cheeseburger and hates her nickname, "Running [[Rabbit|Bunny]]." She has a close friend, [[Akai Ringo (mochimako)|]] and a brother, [[finn blanchflower|Finn]]. She is a "Transer", who has an ability that can transfer herself from "Trans World" (our earth) to a fantasy world called "Cis world." She and her work-buddy, [[wolger wolfman|Wolger]], who is another main character of this story, are members of "Central Corps."

She is often depicted with [[brown hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her uniform in the Cis world has a kind of [[hoodie]] with [[rabbit ears]].

h4.External Links

* Official profile: http://nobu.boy.jp/c2/monica.htm 
* Her Twitter Bot created by [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]: [s]h[/s][s]ttp://twitter.com/ANWC_monica[/s] (Dead link)
* Twitter Bot's description: [s]h[/s][s]ttp://nobu.boy.jp/bot.htm#moni[/s] (Dead link)

title: frode_grim-reaper
body:
フルーデ・グリムリーパー 

A character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story. He is [[Chloe Fleurage]]'s sidekick and one of "Turn Creatures", inhabitants of Cis world. These monster-like creatures have abilities to shapeshift (post #1100256 and "#1101324)":[/post/show/1101324/] and boost their masters' combat capability. 

He has two [[horns]], [[wings]], [[extra eyes|multiple eyes]] with a [[blindfold]] and [[sharp teeth]]. 
Like Chloe, he's fond of sweets.

title: chloe_fleurage
body:
クロエ・フルラージュ (Chloe Fleurage) 

A character from "World Crusher", one of [[Mochimako (mushikera Hoi2)|]]'s [[original]] universe/story. Her nickname is ロエ (Loe). 

She was born in France, raised in New York and currently living in Japan. She is a "Transer", who has an ability that can transfer herself from "Trans World" (our earth) to a fantasy world called "Cis world." She always works alongside her (beloved?) fellow transer, [[Annerose Redrum]]. 

She is often depicted with [[white hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Her uniform in the Cis world has [[striped]] [[single thighhigh]]s, and a [[hoodie]] of some sort.

title: crux_(constellation)
body:
Crux (the [[Cross]], commonly known as the [i]Southern Cross[/i]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. It is the smallest yet one of the most distinguishable constellations. Its brightest star is Acrux.

Crux is an easily recognizable constellation. Its 4 bright stars form a Latin cross '✝' with a slightly tilted horizontal line and a red star on top. It technically has a fifth star that is not connected to the main cross pattern. The constellation lies directly between the "legs" of [[Centaurus (constellation)|]] (the Centaur).

The prominent features of Crux, along with the brightest stars of Centaurus, serve as pointers to the South Celestial Pole. The constellation appears on the flags of [[australian flag|Australia]], [[brazilian flag|Brazil]], [[new zealand flag|New Zealand]], [[papua new guinean flag|Papua New Guinea]] and [[samoan flag|Samoa]].

h4. Examples
* !asset #23246616
* !asset #23245840: Crux and Centaurus
* !post #1676940

h4. Neighboring  constellations
* [[Centaurus (constellation)|]]
* Musca

h4. External links
* "eSky: Crux":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/crux.html
* "Wikipedia: Crux":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crux

title: giant_penguin
body:
Palaeeudyptinae, the giant penguins, are an extinct subfamily of [[penguin|penguins]] known to have existed from the mid-Eocene into the late Oligocene and possibly into the Miocene. Some of its members, such as [[Anthropornis]] and Pachydyptes, are some of the largest penguin species ever known.

h4. Species
* Palaeeudyptes
** Palaeeudyptes antarcticus
** Palaeeudyptes gunnari
** Palaeeudyptes marplesi
** Palaeeudyptes klekowskii
* Archaeospheniscus
** Archaeospheniscus lowei
** Archaeospheniscus lopdelli
** Archaeospheniscus wimani
* Anthropornis
** Anthropornis nordenskjoeldi
** Anthropornis grandis
* Pachydyptes ponderosus
* Platydyptes
** Platydyptes marplesi
** Platydyptes novaezealandiae
** Platydyptes amiesi
* Anthropodyptes gilli (?)

h4. See also
* [[Emperor penguin]]
* [[Giant Penguin (Kemono Friends)]]

h4. External links
* "Palaeeudyptinae":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palaeeudyptinae

title: sagittarius_(constellation)
body:
Sagittarius (the Archer) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere, between [[Scorpius (constellation)|]] to the west and [[Capricorn (constellation)|Capricornus]] to the east. Its brightest star is Kaus Australis.

Sagittarius has the rough appearance of a stick-figure centaur archer drawing a bow. The brightest stars of the constellation form an asterism known as the [i]Teapot[/i].

title: centaurus_(constellation)
body:
Centaurus (the [[Centaur]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest stars are [i]Alpha[/i] and [i]Beta Centauri[/i].

Centaurus, along with [[Sagittarius (constellation)|]], another centaur-associated constellation, has the rough appearance of a stick-figure centaur. Directly to its left lies [[Lupus (constellation)|]] (the Wolf), often interpreted as an animal that has been killed or is about to be killed by the Centaur. And between its "legs" lies [[Crux (constellation)|]], commonly known as the Southern Cross. 

The brightest stars of Centaurus, along with the prominent features of Crux, serve as pointers to the South Celestial Pole.

title: piscis_austrinus_(constellation)
body:
Piscis Austrinus (the Southern [[Fish]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere. It was formerly known as Piscis Notius. Its brightest star is Fomalhaut (lit. "mouth of the fish").

Piscis Austrinus is sometimes depicted as being directly connected to [[Aquarius (constellation)|]] (the Water-Bearer) by Fomalhaut, although this star belongs exclusively to Piscis Austrinus. The connection symbolizes the pouring of water from Aquarius into the mouth of the Southern Fish. The constellation used to have a tail running southward, which was later separated into the constellation of [[Grus (constellation)|]] (the Crane).

title: afterglow
body:
As in "basking in the afterglow" - the warm, glowing feeling of bliss that lingers following [[orgasm]] after engaging in [[happy sex]]. 

For this tag to apply, it should be clear that the affection hasn't really finished, but the physical activity is merely winding down. The persons involved should still emotionally focused on each other, doing things like [[cuddling]], [[spooning]], [[holding hands]], making [[eye contact]], and similar indications of affection, possibly also (literally) [[sleeping]] together through the night. If the partners have disengaged from one another, then the "encounter" really is over, and this tag should not be used.

Contrasted with [[after sex]], which indicates graphic, physical evidence of prior sex, use of [[afterglow]] should be based on the apparent emotional state of those involved. Also note that, while they can coexist, these two tags tend to be mutually exclusive due to reasons of conflicting mood and style.

For the group from [[BanG Dream!]], refer to [[Afterglow (BanG Dream!)]].

H4. See also

* [[couple]]
* [[foreplay]] for similarly passionate gestures and actions before sex

title: aquarius_(constellation)
body:
Aquarius (the Water Bearer) is a [[zodiac]] [[constellation]] located in the Southern celestial hemisphere, between [[Capricorn (constellation)|Capricornus]] to the west and [[Pisces (constellation)|]] to the east. Aquarius is the second largest zodiac constellation after Virgo. Its brightest star is Sadalsuud.

Aquarius is sometimes depicted as being directly connected to [[Piscis Austrinus (constellation)|]] (the Southern Fish) by Fomalhaut, although this star belongs exclusively to Piscis Austrinus. The connection symbolizes the pouring of water from Aquarius into the mouth of the Southern Fish. The Y-shaped star pattern at the top of the constellation forms an asterism called the "Water Jar".

title: anthropornis
body:
Anthropornis ("man bird") is an extinct genus of giant [[penguin]] ([[giant penguin|Palaeeudyptinae]]) that existed from around the Lutetian stage of the Eocene epoch to the Rupelian stage of the Oligocene. Described from fossils found in the La Meseta Formation on Seymour Island off the [[Antarctica|Antarctic]] coast, they are some of the largest penguins ever known, having reached heights of up to 1.8 metres. The genus comprises two species:

* Anthropornis nordenskjoldi
* Anthropornis grandis

title: millipede
body:
A flattened arthropod with a long, segmented body. Millipedes usually feed on dead or decaying plant matter. Millipedes have a pair of legs on their second through fourth body segments, and two pairs of legs on most following segments. Millipedes defend themselves from attack by coiling up to protect their bodies with their exoskeleton, and by using chemical defenses.

body: The kim-kim or Udu is a plosive aerophone (in this case implosive) and an idiophone of the Igbo of Nigeria. In the Igbo language, ùdù means 'vessel' or 'pot'. This is a hand percussion instrument and it is one of the most important instruments in Igbo music.

body: The morin khuur (Mongolian: морин хуур) also known as the horsehead fiddle, is a traditional Mongolian bowed stringed instrument. It is one of the most important musical instruments of the [[mongolia|Mongol]] people, and is considered a symbol of the nation of Mongolia.

title: race_queen
body:
A model usually present at auto racing events. They are typically seen wearing skimpy outfits bearing the logos of the racing team and/or its sponsors. Their official job is to hold a [[parasol]] over the driver to shield them from sunlight while their car is being worked on. Also known as a [i]grid girl[/i] or [i]umbrella girl[/i].

The term [i]race queen[/i] can be used interchangeably with the terms [i]campaign girl[/i] and [i][[booth babe]][/i] as all refer to models in skimpy outfits. Campaign girls can be seen more in trade shows and the like, specially those that market [[motor vehicle]]s, while booth babes are seen in smaller booths, especially acting as booth tenders or helpers.

Due to the increased presence of women in motorsports and safety concerns regarding their outfits in pit lanes, race queens have been phased out of almost all major motorsport series, with [[Super GT]], [[Moto GP]], and [[Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters]] being notable holdouts - DTM even offering the option for male pit models to accompany female drivers.

The most recognizable form of race queen outfit is a revealing outfit usually consisting of a [[crop top]] or [[tube top]] with a [[skirt]] or [[shorts]], designed to highlight the model's [[midriff]] and legs, although [[highleg leotard]]s and [[highleg_one-piece_swimsuit|swimsuits]] with or without additional accessories have also been common as outfits especially during the 1990s in Japan. Recently, race queens in less revealing outfits have also become more common, primarily in regions outside of Japan that still employ them - their outfits will usually consist of form-fitting [[dress]]es or [[bodysuit]]s instead. 

h4. Examples
* !post #97431: A typical race queen outfit
* !post #2246767: Racing PIAA race queen wearing a white leotard/one-piece swimsuit with sash
* !post #3122297: [[Pacific Racing Team]]'s 2015 race queen outfit
* !post #6638123: [[Racing Project Bandoh]]'s 2024 race queen outfit with a [[bodystocking]]
* !asset #21090138: [[Sawa Sumire]], a [[real life]] race queen in [[Autobacs Racing Team Aguri]]'s 2022 outfit

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Race queen":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Race_queen

The earliest example of bolt-action gun that is fielded by an military is the Prussian [[Dreyse needle gun]]

title: katsuragi_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Katsuragi[/i], introduced in the April 2015 event. 
Character design by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She is portrayed with [[long_hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[flat chest]]. Her base outfit consists of a green [[furisode]] with orange [[camouflage]] patterns, [[green sash|green]] [[obi]] with her real-life flight deck camouflage pattern, [[white shirt]] top, [[muneate]] patterned off her real-life bow, white [[fundoshi]], and [[green footwear|green]] [[platform footwear]]. 

In her kai form, she disposes of the kimono entirely, and wears a [[pleated skirt]], [[uneven gloves|asymmetric]] [[fingerless gloves]], with one being [[elbow_gloves|an elbow glove]], and [[black thighhighs]] to create [[zettai ryouiki]]. 

She is a huge admirer of [[Zuikaku (kancolle)|]] and frequently calls her senpai. At the time of Katsuragi's completion, Zuikaku was the only remaining standard aircraft carrier in the IJN apart from the Unryuu-class. 

h4. Skins

title: sucrose_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character.

An alchemist from Mondstadt who is actually very good at preserving and encouraging the growth of living things (in a non-threatening way), she's painfully shy around other people but is quite gung-ho about her research. A classic shy science-type.

She has hard-to-see [[animal ears]], which are most likely [[cat ears]] (see "Sucrose's Story 2":[https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Sucrose/Story#Story_2]) or [[fox ears]] (see [[Yae Miko]]). 

She is named 砂糖 (Shātáng, literally meaning "granulated sugar") in the Chinese script, and thus is tagged like that on Pixiv oftentimes.

Rosaria is a sister in Mondstadt's Church of Favonius. Despite her position, she often procrastinates her work. title: kikka_(airplane)
body:
The [b]Nakajima Kikka[/b], sometimes known by its misattributed designation J9N or J9Y, was a jet fighter build for the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] during the later stage of [[World War II]]. It was the first jet fighter ever built by Japan.

Although it bears a strong resemblance to the German [[Me 262]], the plane is not directly related. Only two prototypes were completed before the war's end, thus the plane never entered service. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8107625

h4.See Also
* [[Ki-201 Karyuu]] - IJA's more direct derivative of the Me 262
* [[list of airplanes]]

h4.External Links
* "Wikipedia: Nakajima Kikka":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nakajima_Kikka

title: n1k
body:
A late-war [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] aircraft.
Can refer to the original N1K [i]Kyoufuu[/i] seaplane fighter or the later N1K1-J/N1k2-J [i]Shiden[/i] land fighter.

h4. [i]Kyoufuu[/i]
As originally designed by Kawanishi Aircraft (post-war ShinMaywa), it was a single-float seaplane fighter meant to be used from shore bases that didn't have airfields for proper fighters. By the time the N1K entered service, its role was no longer necessary or appropriate.

h4. [i]Shiden[/i] (and [i]Shiden-kai[/i])

Kawanishi saw the potential of the N1K as a true fighter and pursued it as a private company venture, entering service in early 1944 as one of the few aircraft that allowed the Japanese to face off against late-war Allied fighters. Nevertheless, it was produced too late and in not enough numbers for the Japanese to turn the tide of the war.

h4. Appearance

* !post #5280964: Kyoufuu (N1K)
* !post #1782944: Shiden (N1K1)

A carrier-based variant (N1K3-A Shiden KAI 2) was produced but there was no need for them at a time when the IJN ran short of carrier-qualified pilots.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Kawanishi N1K":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawanishi_N1K]

title: kawanishi_e15k
body:
The [b]Kawanishi E15K[/b] was a reconnaissance [[seaplane]] developed in the early 1940s for the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]]. 

The E15K was designed to equip the [i]Ooyodo[/i]-class light cruisers, which were originally envisioned as flagships for submarine flotillas, with long-range aerial reconnaissance capabilities. The aircraft was built for speed, with retractable stabilizing floats in the wings and the ability to jettison the central main float in an emergency, but neither the retractable floats nor the main float jettison system worked reliably in practice. The aircraft also suffered from significant mechanical unreliability and high maintenance needs.

Ultimately, the planned use of the [i]Ooyodo[/i] class was abandoned and the [[Ooyodo (Kancolle)|single completed ship of the class]] was refitted as a command cruiser for surface formations instead.  Only 15 E15Ks were produced, and none was ever carried by [[Ooyodo (Kancolle)|Ooyodo]].  Even so, some [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] fan artists depict her with them instead of the [[Aichi E13A]] scout seaplanes she actually carried.

Called [b][i]Shiun[/i][/b] ("Violet Cloud")  by the Japanese, the E15K had the Allied reporting name [b]Norm[/b]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #8115304

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Kawanishi E15K":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kawanishi_E15K]

body:
Mint chewing gum by [[Lotte (company)|]].

Posts with this tag reference the gum's "Boutique" commercial, wherein Ikuta Toma's breath magically turns a store clerk into [[Asahina Mikuru]], the store manager into [[Suzumiya Haruhi]], and a trio of stray cats into a group of [[cat ears|cat-eared]] [[Nagato Yuki]].

30 second version transcript:
Clerk 1: "I'm sorry, we're all out."
Customer: "Oh, I see." *sighs*
Clerk 1: *inhales*
*poof*
Mikuru: "What wonderful breath."
Clerk 2: "Hey mister, you're causing trouble!  Do you think it's okay to go around turning people into anime characters?"
Customer: "Sorry!"
Clerk 2: *inhales*
*poof*
Haruhi: "Hey, that's really great!"
Customer: *runs outside panting*
Cats: "..."
*poof*
Nagatos: "Nya~n."
Announcer: "Gum designed for fresh breath.  Lotte.  Acuo."

h4. External links
* "Youtube: ACUO Haruhi CM 30s":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DgS9vWSWnrs
* "Youtube: Acuo Haruhi CM 15s Ver":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DTB9hmvxmM

title: page_tear
body:
A subset of [[revealing layer]], where a torn piece of the image reveals something different beneath. This might be a character's [[underwear]] or [[nude]] body, while the untorn parts still keep them in their clothes. The particular technique is well-known for being used in "Mousatsu" series.

For [[ripping]] an actual piece of [[paper]], see [[tearing paper]].

h4.See also

* [[revealing layer]]

title: deep-fried_(distortion)
body:
Images that are [[distortion|distorted]] to a degree where they look like they've been run through several filters.

They usually feature [[saturated|high saturation]] and [[overexposure|high exposure]], and may also have [[film grain]], [[ringing artifacts]] and/or [[jpeg artifacts on purpose|intentional JPEG artifacts]].

title: hisou_tensoku
body:
核熱造神ヒソウテンソク (Thermonuclear Deity Hisoutensoku)

A giant humanoid form that is seen by the main characters of [[Touhou Hisoutensoku]]. Revealed to be a nuclear reactor-powered doll made by the kappa as a publicity stunt.

Often drawn as an actual [[mecha]], the design having a great deal of similarity to [[mazinger_z|Mazinger Z]] or [[great_mazinger|Great Mazinger]], especially via the spikes on the sides of its head and the frequent inclusion of wings resembling the Jet Scrander.

h4. External links

* "Hisou Tensoku on Touhou Wiki":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hisoutensoku
other_names: 核熱造神ヒソウテンソク

title: absinthe
body:
A highly [[alcohol]]ic anise-flavored spirit derived from various culinary herbs such as grand wormwood, green anise, sweet fennel, and others.   Traditionally it has a green color, though it may also be colorless. 

It is normally diluted with cold water and sweetened before drinking, due to its strong and bitter taste, and sometimes served with an [[absinthe spoon]].

In classical literature the drink is commonly referred to as "la fée verte" (the green fairy).

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Absinthe":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Absinthe

body:

title: tharja_("normal_girl")_(fire_emblem)
body:
Tag used for [[Tharja (Fire Emblem)|]] from [[Fire Emblem]], specifically when dressed in her winter attire from the [[Fire Emblem Heroes]] 2017 "Winter’s Envoy":[https://feheroes.fandom.com/wiki/Winter's_Envoy_(Focus)] banner.

Can typically be identified thanks to the attire's characteristics: a red and black [[bikini armor]] with a red and white [[cloak]], held together by a red and green [[ribbon]] (which also feature on her hips) with a small [[bell]], and fake [[antlers]] with [[christmas ornaments|ornaments]] at the ends.

May be depicted with her weapon, a silver [[candelabra]] with red [[candle]]s.

Note that it's possible (especially for older artwork), to depict Tharja in a winter outfit without it being the one described above, in which case this tag should not be used.

title: cordelia_(fire_emblem)
body:
[i]"Our only limits are the ones we place on ourselves."
[/i] -During a support conversation with [[Sumia (fire emblem)|]]

[b]Cordelia[/b] (ティアモ, Tiamo) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Awakening]].

A beautiful Ylissean [[pegasus knight uniform (fire emblem)|Pegasus Knight]] who is also considered a genius. She also provides the basis of [[Caeldori (Fire Emblem)|Caeldori]] in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is voiced by Eimi Okada in the Japanese version and Julie Ann Taylor in the English version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: [[Pegasus Knight Uniform (fire Emblem)|Pegasus Knight]]

title: ushi_no_koku_mairi
body:
"Shrine visit on the hour of the ox". A Japanese ritual to curse someone to death. The person performing the ritual must dress in white, wear a tripod on their head holding three lit candles, and visit a shrine during the hour of the ox (1:00-3:00 AM). There, the person must nail a [[straw doll]] representing the target of the curse to a sacred tree using a five-inch nail. On the seventh day of performing this ritual without being discovered, the target will die.
Commonly associated with [[Mizuhashi Parsee]] due to the Bridge Princess character she's based on being the origin of the ritual, and one of her Spell Cards being named after it.

Since the image of a nail driven through a straw doll is ubiquitous to represent curses, this tag should be reserved for traditional portrayals of the ritual.

For another case where a character is wearing candles on their head (especially a number other than three), without the other parts of this ritual (i.e. no [[mallet]], [[hammer]], [[straw doll]], or [[nail (hardware)|]]s), it might instead be a reference to the youkai [[Hashihime]].

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia - Ushi no Toki Mairi":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ushi_no_toki_mairi]
* "Wikipedia (Japanese) - Ushi no Koku Mairi":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%91%E3%81%AE%E5%88%BB%E5%8F%82%E3%82%8A]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia - Ushi no Koku Mairi":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%B8%91%E3%81%AE%E5%88%BB%E5%8F%82%E3%82%8A]

title: candle
body:
An object made of [[wax]] with a [[string]] running from top to bottom which is set alight. Its most common shape is cylindrical.

Has seen more use in the past, but it is still used as a [[light]] source in some places, in religious ceremonies and as a symbol of different things such as hope.

If the candles are worn strapped to the head with a [[headband]], there might be a reference to the youkai [[Hashihime]], or the curse ritual [[Ushi no Koku Mairi]] (which also involves a [[mallet]] or [[hammer]], a [[straw doll]] and [[nail (hardware)|]]s).

h4. See also
* [[candlelight]]
* [[candlestand]]
* [[candle wax]]
* [[chandelier]]
* [[lamp]]
** [[lamppost]]

title: hashihime
body:
A youkai from [[Japanese Mythology]]. Her name translates to "[[Bridge]] Princess". She is a jealous spirit depicted with a [[white robe]] or [[white kimono|kimono]] with [[fire|flaming]] [[candle]]s on her head. The origin of the story is unclear, but is believed to be based on a woman waiting for her lover to meet her under a bridge, only for him to run off with another woman. 

[[Mizuhashi Parsee]] is based on this character.

If the scene depicts a character with (especially three) candles on her head, with a [[mallet]] or [[hammer]] and [[nail (hardware)|]]s, and/or a [[straw doll]]. It is probably (also) a reference to the [[Ushi no Koku Mairi]] ritual, which involves cursing a person.

h4. External references
* "Wikipedia - Hashihime":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hashihime]
* "Wikipedia (Japanese) - Hashihime":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A9%8B%E5%A7%AB]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia - Hashihime":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E6%A9%8B%E5%A7%AB]

title: curse_(pokemon)
body:
A move in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]][/i] media.

When Curse is used by a [[ghost]], the battle animation shows a [[nail (hardware)|]] piercing the user. This hurts the user and curses the target to lose HP each turn.

When used by a non-ghost, the user loses Speed, and its Attack and Defense rise.

title: hard_drive
body:
A hard disk drive (HDD) is an electro-mechanical data storage device that stores data using magnetic fields and one or more rigid rapidly rotating platters coated with magnetic material.

title: feixianji_(hairstyle)
body: Traditional Chinese hairstyle. Translates to Flying Immortal Hair-coil. Two [[hair rings]] loop atop the head, similar to the Japanese chigomage, but unlike the chigomage, these hair loops are larger and looser, and incline towards the back of the head. They may resemble rabbit ears, or a bow. Another variant is the Chuihuan fenxiaoji, meaning hanging hair with split coil. These two hair rings drape over the side of the scalp, often creating [[asymmetrical hair]]. It's often associated with purity and virginity, as the hairstyle was worn by young maidens in the [[Tang Dynasty]]. h4. Examples * !post #7863326 * !post #7699346 * !post #7698825 h4. See also * [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]] * [[Shuangyaji]]

title: ai_drawing_anime_characters_eating_ramen_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] stemming from various [[AI-generated]] images of characters eating [[ramen]] in bizarre ways, typically involving characters holding noodles with their bare hands. This is typically due to the AI's inability to properly draw hands or chopsticks. Some variations also include ramen being a part of a character's hair or body.

title: ping_pong_(manga)
body:
Ping Pong is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Taiyō Matsumoto about table tennis. It was serialized in Shogakukan's seinen manga magazine Big Comic Spirits from 1996 to 1997. The story follows high schoolers and childhood friends [[Hoshino Yutaka|Peco]] and [[Tsukimoto Makoto|Smile]], compete in the national table tennis tournament where they face talented players from all over the country.

It was adapted into a 2002 live-action film. An anime television series adaptation called Ping Pong the Animation produced by Tatsunoko Production and [[Science SARU]], directed by Masaaki Yuasa was aired on Fuji TV's noitamina block between April and June 2014. It was notable for using rotoscoping, rather than more conventional anime art styles. 

h4. Characters
* [[Tsukimoto Makoto]], "Smile"
* [[Hoshino Yutaka]], "Peco"
* [[Kong Wenge]], "China"

title: qi_lolita
body:
Qi Lolita is a style very similar to [[Wa Lolita]] but instead of being inspired by the [[japanese clothes|Japanese traditional styles]], it is influenced by [[chinese clothes|Chinese traditional wear]] (e. g. [[china dress|Qipao]] or [[Hanfu]]), culture and other things related to the styles and influences.

Common features of Qi Lolita are [[mandarin collar]]s, [[Chinese knot]]s, [[tassel]]s, [[pankou]]s, [[side slit]]s over a petticoat and Lolita-style interpretations of the [[qixiong ruqun]]. 

h4. Examples

* !post #5075559: [[China dress]] inspired Qi Lolita
* !post #4705112: Qi Lolita with Qipao elements like [[tassel]]s and [[pankou]]s.
* !post #5543073: Qi Lolita based on [[qixiong ruqun]], with [[hagoromo]] and [[yunjian]]

h4. See also

* [[Lolita fashion]]
* [[tag group:Fashion style]]

title: toggles
body:
Large [[buttons|button]]-like fasteners that typically consist of a (usually) wooden peg that fits into a string loop to hold a [[coat]] together.  

Also descriptive of the [[pankou|frog buttons]] used to fasten clothing such as [[China dress]]es and [[tangzhuang]], where a knot instead of a peg is used.

h4. See also

title: vera:_rozen_(agony_break)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Vera (pgr)|]]'s [[vera: rozen (pgr)|Rozen frame]].

A [[nurse]] themed [[halloween costume]] for the Rozen frame, highly mechanical in appearance with the left arm ([[single mechanical arm]]) and both legs as [[mechanical legs|mechanical]]. Keeping her [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]] but hair colour is now [[gradient hair|gradient]] with [[red hair|red]] roots to [[white hair|white]] tips, [[parted hair|hair parts]] into two halves at the lower end. Left eye is [[one eye covered|covered]] by a [[medical eyepatch]], but blood can be seen dripping down ([[blood from eyes]], [[blood on face]]). Wears a [[nurse cap]] and a [[white ribbon|white]] [[hair ribbon]] on the back.

The outfit is a [[blood on clothes|blood stained]] [[torn bodysuit|torn]] [[backless bodysuit|backless]] [[white bodysuit]], no clothing on the lower body except for the [[bandaged leg|bandaged right leg]]. Left sleeve is [[torn sleeve|torned]] and exposes the mechanical arm, sleeves has puffy shoulders ([[juliet sleeves]]). A [[blood bag]] is taped on to her stomach, a pair of [[surgical scissors]], a [[scalpel]] and a [[syringe]] are taped to her right forearm.

title: rosetta:_rigor_(niki_us1000)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Rosetta (pgr)|]]'s [[Rosetta: Rigor (pgr)|Rigor frame]].

While still retaining a mostly mechanical body like her default appearance, several elements are changed, Niki is a racing themed coating, her [[cyborg]] body is painted mostly in black white and red, with various [[decal]]s painted on her body. The only biological feature is her head, with a new [[bob cut]] hair style and an orange [[streaked hair|streak]].

title: rosetta:_rigor_(einherjar)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Rosetta (pgr)|]]'s [[Rosetta: Rigor (pgr)|Rigor frame]].

While still retaining a mostly mechanical body like her default appearance, several elements are changed, almost [[monochrome]] in coloration, the Einherjar coating is almost entirely black and white.

Hair colour is now more [[white hair|white]], center-flap bangs is now simply [[double-parted bangs]], eye colour changed from yellow to [[blue eyes|blue]] with [[horizontal pupils]], as well as the addition of dark brown [[eyeshadow]] makeup.

The Einherjar coating has a single [[mechanical wings|mechanical wings]] mounted on the left shoulder instead of both, the skin of her abdomen section is entirely [[see-through body|translucent]] and her [[mechanical spine]] is visible from the outside.

title: vera:_rozen_(night_fever)_(pgr)
body:
An [[official alternate costume|alternate coating]] of [[Vera (pgr)|]]'s [[vera: rozen (pgr)|Rozen frame]].

Night Fever coating is a set of new apparels for the Rozen frame, no mechanical bodily features, as well as slight changes to her hair style. She still has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[red hair]], but the sidelocks are shorter and the hair no longer parts from behind. [[Red eyes]] with [[cross-shaped pupils]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under left eye]]. Left ear has a single [[earpiece]], right ear has a small [[hoop earrings]], headwear is a [[black headwear|black]] [[baseball cap]] with two [[horned headwear|horns]] on the sides and a white [[pom pom (clothes)|]] on top.

Her body clothes consist of a [[fishnet top|fishnet]] [[front-tie top]], a [[black jacket]] typically [[off shoulder|worn hanging off her arms]] with gold trims, a [[front slit]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]] and an [[asymmetrical pants|asymmetrical]] [[black leggings]]. Footwear is a pair of [[high heels|high heeled]] [[spiked boots|spiked]] [[black footwear|black]] [[ankle boots]], right leg has a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[pink thighhighs|pink thighhigh]] with [[star print]]s, the visible areas of the [[single sock|single]] left [[ankle socks]] is depicted [[torn socks|torned]].

title: sophia:_silverfang_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Sophia (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], [[cyborg]] in appearance.

h4. Appearance
The Silverfang frame is [[petite]] ([[flat chest]]) in body shape, has [[orange eyes]], [[dark skin]] ([[dark-skinned female]]) with [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] in a [[bob cut]] style with [[asymmetrical bangs]]. She has [[bags under eyes]] and facial [[freckles]], her hair is adorned with five [[x hair ornament]]s. Both of her arms are [[mechanical arms|mechanical]], attached on her biceps, she also has two mechanical appendages ([[extra arms]]) from a device attached on her lower back, [[robot joints]] can be seen on her elbow, wrist, and on the extra mechanical arms.

Clothing consist of a [[white bodysuit|white]] [[skintight]] [[bodysuit]] with [[juliet sleeves]] and [[turtleneck]] [[high collar]] design. For legwear she wears a pair of [[toeless legwear|toeless]] [[white thighhighs|white]] [[thighhighs]] with [[no shoes]]. Other apparel elements include: a [[mechabare|mechanical part/device]] attached to her [[chest protector]], [[canister]]s attached to her back device, [[drum magazine]]s attached to the end of her extra mechanical arms. [[Dual wielding|Dual wields]] [[handgun|pistol handguns]] as her weapons.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])

title: watanabe:_nightblade_(pgr)
body:
A frame of [[Watanabe (pgr)|]] from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]].

h4. Appearance
The Nightblade frame has [[medium hair|medium length]] [[grey hair]], a [[half updo]] into a [[ponytail]], [[antenna hair]] and [[hair intakes]], he has [[heterochromia]] eyes, [[blue eyes|blue left]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow right]]. Other notable facial features includes a [[barcode]] [[forehead tattoo]] and a [[scar on cheek|scar on left cheek]]. Typically depicted with only the left arm being [[mechanical arms|mechanical]] ([[single mechanical arm]]), though depending on awakening level of the frame, both arms can be mechanical.

Apparel consist of several layers, inner-most is a black [[bodysuit]] with [[mechanical]] elements, followed by a dark brown [[waistcoat]], outerwear is a [[brown coat|brown/beige]] [[trench coat]], [[black pants|black suit pants]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. Other note worthy apparels are [[harness]] and wearing [[multiple belts]].

[[dual wielding|Dual wields]] [[dagger]]s/[[machete]]s for weapons.

h4. List of Alternate Coatings ([[official alternate costume|alternative costumes]])

title: irn-bru
body:
Originally Iron Brew, this is a [[Scotland|Scottish]] [[soda]] that is described as "Scotland's other national drink" after [[Scotch whisky]]. Glasgow-based A.G. Barr manufactures the drink, first introduced in 1901. It has long been the most popular soda in Scotland ahead of the likes of [[Coca-Cola]], [[Pepsi]] and [[Fanta]] and is also sold elsewhere in the United Kingdom. In addition, it can also be found internationally in areas where there is a sizable Scottish community.

title: we_live_in_a_society_social_media_reactions_(meme)
body:
"We Live In a Society Social Media Reactions" refers to a series of images that juxtapose a popular item with a complex but underappreciated one, using photoshopped social media reactions to highlight the disparity.
This format first appeared on May 12th, 2018, when Twitter user 660th posted an image of [[Mickey Mouse]] with positive reactions next to a detailed illustration of a mouse with no reactions, captioned "We live in a society".

Note that this meme is unrelated to the [[We Live in a Society_(meme)|]] meme that involves the [[Joker_(dc)|]] and an usually more "edgy" theme.

h4. Original
* !asset #23224283
h4. External Links:
* "Twitter: @660th: We live in a society (archived)":[https://web.archive.org/web/20180515014633/https://twitter.com/660th/status/995384248440942592]
* "KnowYourMeme: We Live In a Society Social Media Reactions":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/we-live-in-a-society-social-media-reactions]

title: eddie_brock
body: Edward "Eddie" Charles Allan Brock is a fictional character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. The character was created by David Michelinie and Todd McFarlane, making a cameo appearance in Web of [[Spider-Man (series)|Spider-Man]] #18 (September 1986), before making his first full appearance in The Amazing Spider-Man #300 (May 1988) as the most well-known host of the [[venom (marvel)|Venom]] symbiote.

title: venom_(marvel)
body:
A shapeshifting villain/anti-hero from the [[Spider-Man (series)|]] series of comic books published by [[Marvel]].

Venom is an alien symbiote that initially attaches itself to [[Peter Parker]], leading to the creation of the Symbiote Suit (or the black Spider-Man suit). However, the power boost granted by the alien entity proves to corrupt Peter's mind, and he rids himself of it - leading the scorned creature to take over Parker's rival, [[Eddie Brock]], and swear revenge, eventually settling into the role of an anti-hero.

The symbiote was first introduced as Spider-Man's new black costume in The Amazing Spider-Man #252 (May 1984) as part of a story called "Homecoming!" The story takes place after Spider-Man's return from the events of the miniseries Secret Wars, where he first obtains the black costume. The full first appearance of Venom is in The Amazing Spider-Man #300 (May 1988), after the symbiote bonds with Eddie Brock.

title: transparent
body:
An object other than clothing that actually, physically allows some amount of light to pass through it. If a normally opaque object such as a wooden desk is rendered partly invisible by artistic fiat, that's [[x-ray]].

If some article of clothing is transparent, use [[see-through clothes]] instead. If a person seems to be disappearing, [[fading]] may be appropriate as well; for a character's skin that's transparent, see [[see-through body]].
h4. See also

title: ai-generated_encore_(meme)

Redraws and references to an [[AI-generated art (topic)|AI-generated]] [[Hatsune Miku]] artwork posted by [[pon pon pon ai]]. The image's striking style caused it to go viral, with many artists and fans expressing disappointment upon learning that it was an AI generated image, which in turn sparked a trend of artists redrawing the piece by hand.

title: chiang_kai-shek
body: A prominent leader of the Republic of [[China]]. After having led the country starting in 1928, he was [[chinese civil war|defeated]] by [[Mao Zedong]]'s communist forces in 1949, from then on serving as the leader of the government-in-exile on [[Taiwan]] until his death in 1975. Known for his charismatic leadership yet his inability suppress the widespread corruption within his country, which led to his eventual downfall on mainland China.

title: lovander
body:
[quote]Seeking a night of love, it is always chasing someone around. At first it only showed interest in other Pals, but in recent years even humans have become the target of its debauchery.[/quote]

A [[Pal (Creature)|]] from [[Palworld]], Paldex entry no. 69 (yes, that's intentional). Lovander is a majority female, pink bipedal lizard with a heart motif. She is famed for being a canonical sex pest, to the point that not even humans, Pal Tamers or otherwise, are safe from her insatiable lust.

title: stippling_(texture)
body:
A shading technique, where shadow is applied using dots of varying density. Often done by hand in [[traditional media]], but in digital media, digital brushes can replicate this effect. 

For artwork made up entirely of dots, see [[pointillism]].

For the similar dot-like shapes seen in manga screentones and [[pixel art]], see [[dithering]] instead.

h4. Examples
* !asset #23215628
* !post #8179216


h4. See also
* [[Hatching (texture)]]

h4. External links
"Wikipedia: stippling":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stippling]

title: pointillism
body:
Artwork made up entirely - or almost entirely - out of dots. 

For artwork where only the shading is made up dots, see [[stippling (Texture)|]].

h4. See also
* [[Fine art parody]]
* [[Impressionism]]

title: mizura
body:
One of Japan's oldest hairstyles, worn by [b]men[/b] in the ancient period. It consists of two ponytails, could be long or short, one on either side of the head. These are looped down and back up, each then being secured in place with some sort of wrapping (string, [[hair tie]] or [[hair tubes]]... ). Mizura was worn differently according to social status.

Mizura may be confused with [[shuangyaji]], but this style is for [b]women[/b] & [b]girls[/b], and is often higher up on the head or lower back, being more varying.  

H4. Examples
* !post #7149571
* !post #7945917
* !post #4372604: (Mizura on the upper character.)
* !post #627253
h4. See also
* [[double bun]]
* [[hair rings]]
* [[twintails]]
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

h4. External links
* "A History of Men’s Japanese Clothing and Accessories (by Joshua L. Badgley)":http://www.sengokudaimyo.com/garb/garb.ch04.html
* "Symbolism of Hairstyles in Korea and Japan":https://nirc.nanzan-u.ac.jp/nfile/708

title: shuangyaji
body:
A Chinese women's hairstyle which consists of two [[hair bun]]s, sometimes [[braid|braided]]. It resembles two small coils on the top of the head or beside the forehead; sometimes resembling hair bows made of the person's hair. During the [[Song Dynasty]] in China, it was common for maids and young girls to wear such hairstyle.

Not to be confused with [[mizura]], which is for men.
* !post #3791615
* !post #7711901
* !post #7791361

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Hair Styles]]

title: umamusume:_party_dash

While it's a licensed Umamusume game, it's also a continuation of the various [[kunio-kun series|Kunio-kun sports games]], being developed by [[Arc System Works]], the current caretakers of many Technos properties. It also features [[Golshi's Grand Adventure 2]], a 8-bit style game within the game.

title: blocked_senses
body:
The blocked senses tag is to be used in cases where a character in a image is unable to feel/use (part of) their senses.
This tag is meant for the full blocking of senses, where a character really cant feel anything trough magic or a physical/neurological condition.

This tag should not be used in cases where a character is blindfolded and/or has earplugs.
(In these cases the senses are not really blocked, it is more that stimulation is intercepted before it can reach the body)
For those cases please use the tag: [[sensory_deprivation]]

Scenarios include, but are not limited to:

title: harem_outfit
body:
A form of clothing usually worn by bellydancers. Thus, the ensemble usually emphasizes a bare [[midriff]] and includes a [[bra]], [[bustier]] or [[tube top]]. There may be [[baggy pants]], [[harem pants]], [[loincloth]] or a long [[skirt]] over the legs, as well as possibly a flowing [[headdress]] or [[veil]] and loose sleeves. Jewelry in the form of [[earrings]], [[bracelet]]s, [[necklace]]s or [[anklet]]s may be present. One or more of these articles may be [[see-through clothes|sheer]].

The [[Dunhuang style]] may be mistaken for/look a lot like harem style clothing. 

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Attire]]

title: nazuna_(flower_knight_girl)
body:
English Name: Shepherd's Purse
Birthday: 27th July
Age: Otona-desu.

The mascot and player's assistant in Flower Knight Girl. She serves primarily as the lore guide in the game, as although she is a personification of her namesake flower, she is not a Flower Knight herself.

She has a [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with [[green ribbon]], with a [[strapless dress|strapless]] [[white dress]] and [[elbow gloves]] with a large [[green bow]] behind that emphasize her [[large breasts]] and a [[see-through clothes|see-through]] skirt that exposes her [[panties]].

Her [[osanai nazuna|younger alter ego]] made her debut as a virtual Youtuber on 27th August 2018, one month after Nazuna's birthday.

title: sex_pistols
body: The Sex Pistols are an English punk rock band formed in [[London]] in 1975. Although their initial career lasted just two and a half years, they became one of the most culturally influential acts in popular music. The band initiated the punk movement in the [[United Kingdom]] and inspired many later [[punk]], post-punk and alternative rock musicians, while their clothing and hairstyles were a significant influence on the early punk image.

title: the_who
body: The Who are an English rock band formed in London in 1964. Their classic lineup (1964–1978) consisted of lead vocalist Roger Daltrey, guitarist Pete Townshend, bassist John Entwistle and drummer Keith Moon. They are considered one of the most influential rock bands of the 20th century.

title: mount_kilimanjaro
body:
[b]Mount Kilimanjaro[/b] (/ˌkɪlɪmənˈdʒɑːroʊ/) is a dormant volcano in [[Tanzania]]. With three volcanic cones — Kibo, Mawenzi and Shira — it is the highest mountain in [[Africa]] and the highest single free-standing [[mountain]] above sea level in the world: 5,895 m (19,341 ft) above sea level and 4,900 m (16,100 ft) above its plateau base. It is also the highest [[volcano]] in the Eastern Hemisphere.

Kilimanjaro is the fourth most topographically prominent peak on [[earth_(planet)|Earth]]. It is part of Kilimanjaro National Park and is a major hiking and climbing destination. Because of its shrinking glaciers and ice fields, which are projected to disappear between 2025 and 2035, it has been the subject of many scientific studies.

Place of a pivotal [[mecha]] battle in the [[Zeta Gundam]] science fiction anime series.

title: zeta_gundam_define
body:
A 2011 [[science fiction]] manga by [[Kitazume Hiroyuki]]. It is part of the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]Mobile Suit Zeta Gundam Define[/b] is a new [[comic]] format retelling of the events from the [[Zeta Gundam]] TV anime series from 1985 (of which Kitazume was the main character designer). It features more modern designs as well as new mecha and characters.

h4.Featured original [[mobile suit]]s

title: you're_finished_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
A [[sukeban]]-themed [[oni]] girl [[Duel Monster]] trap card with [[multicolored_hair|red-and-black hair]], [[red eyes]] with [[yellow sclera]], [[freckles]], and a huge [[katana]]. Known as "Kiriban" (lit. "Number Slasher") in OCG.

In much of her fan art, she has a rather surly disposition, particularily due to her obsession with the number 10 and a pun on her name ("kiriban" is a Japanese slang for [[milestone_celebration|nice numbers]] that were often associated with subscriber/post like count).
